body_html:
Because variable_scope is a context manager, I think it is designed to be used like this. You could check all its re-entering test cases:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/variable_scope_test.py

In a word, if you want to re-enter a variable scope,

# correct 
with tf.variable_scope(old_scope):
    # do something

# might wrong
with old_scope:
   # do something

Please correct me if I'm wrong, @lukaszkaiser

body:
Because `variable_scope` is a context manager, I think it is designed to be used like this. You could check all its re-entering test cases:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/variable_scope_test.py

In a word, if you want to re-enter a variable scope, 
```python
# correct 
with tf.variable_scope(old_scope):
    # do something

# might wrong
with old_scope:
   # do something
```

Please correct me if I'm wrong, @lukaszkaiser
